video_description: A video review of the Lenovo ThinkPad Tablet. This is a 10.1" Android OS 3.1 Honeycomb tablet with an IPS display and dual digitizer for both touch and use with an active digitizer pen that sells for $30. The specs are standard 10" Honeycomb: 1GHz Nvidia Tegra 2 dual core CPU, a gig of RAM, plenty of internal storage and dual cameras. The tablet has a full size USB host port, HDMI and an SD card slot. It starts at $499 for the 16 WiFi model. Check out our full written review here: http://www.mobiletechreview.com/tablets/Lenovo-ThinkPad-Tablet.htm
title: Lenovo ThinkPad Tablet Review

comments.text:
@theEpowell1245

It is thick because it has Gorilla glass, Thinkpad build quality, and extra ports.

Also, ask an Electrical Engineer what the biggest trade-off is with thinner electronic gadgets. It is heat! The tablet performance takes a hit due to that, especially when you use intense apps like Netflix or Games.

Example: My Asus Zenbook heats up and﻿ shuts down every time I pay 720P youtube videos for more than 2 or 3 minutes.
comments.author: pogularocky

comments.text: @pogularocky I know all about the necessity to disperse heat in electronic devices, but shutting down every time you watch a video﻿ for 2 or 3 minutes? You're either exaggerating or you have a faulty unit. That doesn't even make sense.
